et exaŭdívit me. ^ I cried to the Lord: líbera ánimam meam a lábiîs iníqŭîs et a lingŭa dolósa. ^ O Lord
deliver my soul from wicked lips and a deceitful tongue.

et exaŭdívit me. ^ I cried to the Lord: aŭt qŭid apponátur tìbi ad lingŭam dolósam~? ^ What shall be given to thee
or what shall be added to thee

et exaŭdívit me. ^ I cried to the Lord: cum carbónibus desolatóriîs. ^ The sharp arrows of the mighty
qŭia incolátus meus prolongátus est. Habitávi cum habitántibus Cedáris~; ^ Woe is me
that my sojourning is prolonged. I have dwelt with the inhabitants of Kedar~;

1 ^ Ad Dòminum qŭum tribulárer clamávi: 6 ^ mùltum ìncola fuit ánima mea. ^ my soul hath been long a sojourner.

impugnábant me gratîs. ^ With them that hated peace I was peaceable~; when I spoke to them
